original: Erneberg, Helge Oscar, redaktör, Skara, f. 23/11/93 i Oskarshamn av handl. o. kantorn Oscar E. o. Maria Karl|sson. G. 25 m. Agnes Sjöstedt. — Studiex. i Linköp. 13. Res. t. Frankr. m. Lars Hiertas stip. 24, Polen m. fl. länder 31, Engl. 32, Schweiz s. statsstip. 39. Medarb. i östgöten o. Södra Dalarnas Tidn. 13, Borlänge o. Mora Tidn. 13-17, redisekr. i Falu Läns Tidn. 17-19, red. av Strengnäs Tidn. 19-35, red. o. utg. av Skara-Posten o. Västergötl. Annonsblad sed. 35, dito av Lidköp. Tidn. Westgöta-Posten sed. 41. Sign.: E-e-e-, Ebe, Après tout m. fl. Var i Strängnäs bl. a. led. av stadsfullm. o. dess be-redn :utsk. samt av styr. f. Strängnäs mod. valmifören. o. Södermani. mod. valm:förb., sekr. i Riksfören. lokal-avd. samt huv :man i Strängnäs Sparbank. Led. av småstädernas lands-rättsförläggn :komm. 32, iled. av ’s^tads-fullm. i Skara sed. 38, ordf. i vandrar-hemskomm. o. Skara högerfören., led. av styr. f. Skarab. högerförb,, ordf. i Skara riksteaterfören. o. i Skara ste-nografifören., led. av styr. f. Skara konstfören., sekr. i rusthållsndn f. SkaTaortens hemvärn, v. ordf. i fören. Nordens lokailavd. Skr.: Den franska ■landsortspres.sen (24), Från biskop Paulinus blad till biskop Strömbergs (26), Strängnäs under stadsfullm. styr. (26), Strängnäsciceronen (30, 8. uppi. 46), I österlandet av västerlandet (32).
translated: Erneberg, Helge Oscar, editor, Skara, born November 23, 1893 in Oskarshamn to merchant and cantor Oscar E. and Maria Karlsson. Married Agnes Sjöstedt in 1925. Completed secondary school in Linköping in 1913. Traveled to France with Lars Hiertas scholarship in 1924, Poland and other countries in 1931, England in 1932, and Switzerland with a state scholarship in 1939. Worked as a contributor for Östgöten and Södra Dalarnas Tidningar in 1913, Borlänge and Mora Tidningar from 1913-1917, and as a secretary in Falu Läns Tidning from 1917-1919. Served as an editor of Strengnäs Tidning from 1919-1935, editor and publisher of Skara-Posten and Västergötl. Annonsblad since 1935, as well as editor and publisher of Lidköping Tidning Westgöta-Posten since 1941. Used the pseudonyms E-e-e-, Ebe, and Après tout. In Strängnäs, served as a member of city council and its preparation committee, as well as the board of directors for Strängnäs modern election association and Södermani modern election association. Was also the secretary of Riksfören. local branch, and was the main chairman of Strängnäs savings bank. Was a member of the small towns’ court relocation committee in 1932 and a member of city council in Skara from 1938. Served as the chairman of the hostel committee and Skara conservative association, as well as the board of directors for Skarab. Conservative association. Also served as the chairman of Skara National Theater Association and Skara stenografifören, as well as a member of the board of directors for Skara art association and the secretary for the local defense for the Skara area. Authored "Den franska landsortspres.sen" (The French Local Press) in 1924, "Från biskop Paulinus blad till biskop Strömbergs" (From Bishop Paulinus to Bishop Strömberg) in 1926, "Strängnäs under stadsfullm. styr." (Strängnäs under City Council Governance) in 1926, "Strängnäsciceronen" (The Strängnäs Guide) in 1930 (revised in 1946), and "I österlandet av västerlandet" (In the East of West) in 1932.

education.description: Completed secondary school in Linköping in 1913.
